MatrixCalc

Class MatrixCalc

  • java.lang.Object
    • MatrixCalc.MatrixCalc

  • public final class MatrixCalc
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods for calculating matrix products. The class currently supports addition, subtraction, scaling, multiplication, and determinant calculations. The matrices are required to be square or rectangular (depending on calculation) 2-dimensional arrays of doubles.

    • Method Summary

      Checks that the two matrices have identical size and returns the result of the addition.

      • add

        public static double[][] add(double[][] firstMatrix,
             double[][] secondMatrix)
        Checks that the two matrices have identical size and returns the result of the addition.
        Parameters:
        firstMatrix - First matrix to be used in the calculation
        secondMatrix - Second matrix to be used in the calculation
        Returns:
        Returns the result of the addition as a 2-dimensional double array

      • scale

        public static double[][] scale(double[][] matrix,
               double scalar)
        Checks that the matrix is rectangular and scales it by multiplying each value with the scalar.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix to be scaled
        scalar - The value by which to scale the matrix
        Returns:
        Returns the result of the multiplication as a 2-dimensional double array

      • multiply

        public static double[][] multiply(double[][] firstMatrix,
                  double[][] secondMatrix)
        Checks that the matrices are rectangular and that the row count of firstMatrix equals the column count of secondMatrix. If the matrices are valid, the longest side of the two matrices is determined. If the longest side is less than the strassenCutoff variable, the matrices are multiplied using the naive method. For larger matrices, the Strassen method is used.
        Parameters:
        firstMatrix - First matrix used in the multiplication
        secondMatrix - Second matrix used in the multiplication
        Returns:
        Returns the result of the multiplication as a 2-dimensional double array

      • determinant

        public static double determinant(double[][] matrix)
        Checks that the matrices are rectangular and that the row count of firstMatrix equals the column count of secondMatrix. If the matrices are valid, the longest side of the two matrices is determined. If the longest side is less than 1024 values long, the matrices are multiplied using the naive method. For larger matrices, the Strassen method is used.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix whose determinant is to be determined
        Returns:
        The determinant of the given matrix

      • invert

        public static double[][] invert(double[][] matrix)
        Checks that the given matrix is square and calculates it's inverse matrix. Note that the method does not check whether or not the give matrix is invertible, so the result matrix may consist of NaN values.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to be inverted

      • setStrassenCutoff

        public static void setStrassenCutoff(int newCutoff)

        public static int getStrassenCutoff()
